business.headline: A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Adani Power in focus as Sebi clean chit sparks fresh rally in Adani Group stocksAdani Power's move stood out, as analysts see strong momentum beyond the short-term sentiment boost. Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating and a target price of Rs 818 per share.

Adani stocks jump up to 10 % after Sebi clean chit in Hindenburg caseThe gains were broad-based across the group's listed entities. Adani Total Gas led the rally, soaring 10% on the BSE. Adani Power climbed 7%, while flagship Adani Enterprises advanced nearly 5%.
Sensex down over 150 points, Nifty below 25,400; Adani Group stocks jumpThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 260.39 points to 82,753.5, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.95 points to 25,366.65 as of 9:29 am.

PF transfers to become easier: Here's what's changing for employeesThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has now introduced two reforms aimed at tackling these bottlenecks. First, it has launched a Passbook Lite feature within the Member Sewa portal.

EPFO launches Passbook Lite: Check features, how it helps membersUntil now, employees had to log in to a separate Passbook Portal to see details of contributions and withdrawals. With the launch of Passbook Lite, members can now access this information directly on the EPFO Member Portal, using just one login.

Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Missed your ITR deadline? 3 filing options you can still useIf you missed the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline, don't panic. Taxpayers still have ways to stay compliant and avoid penalties, with three key filing options available even after the due date.

Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

DreamFolks crisis explained: What's going on and what it means for investorsFounded in 2013, DreamFolks acted as a platform connecting banks, credit card companies, and passengers to airport lounges, food services, baggage handling, and other airport amenities.

US Fed cuts rates for 1st time this year. Will it give a boost to Dalal Street?Lower US interest rates tend to make emerging markets like India more attractive to foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), as dollar assets lose some shine and Treasury yields ease.

Urban Company shares register bumper debut on Dalal Street, but what's next?Urban Company's shares, issued at Rs 103, opened at Rs 162.25 and surged as much as 74% during the day. For those who got shares in the IPO, that meant instant profits and a near $3 billion market value for the company.

Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. Unilever, which is spinning off its ice cream business, thanked Greenfield for his service but disagreed with his claims.

IT, defence or PSU banking: Which sector is likely to see growth on D-Street?PSU banking stocks have started gaining attention after a long period of underperformance, while the IT sector remains in a state of uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty continue winning run amid India-US trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 313.02 points to close at 82,693.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 91.25 points to end at 25,330.25. Broader markets also held their ground, with midcap and smallcap indices finishing in the green.

Business leaders extend heartfelt wishes to PM Modi on 75th birthdayProminent business leaders across India as he celebrated his 75th birthday on Tuesday, with several industrialists praising his transformational leadership and unwavering commitment to the nation's progress.

Want a home loan without the headache? Here's how AI can help youFrom lengthy paperwork to long waiting periods, applying for a home loan often becomes a tedious process filled with red tape, but an AI tool can now make it easy for you.

Cotton farmers face new challenge as quality issues threaten MSPDuring this Kharif season, northern states such as Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, and southern states including Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, experienced prolonged and abnormal rainfall.
Elon Musk congratulates Siddharth Jain, India Inc's 1st executive to own a TeslaElon Musk congratulated Siddharth Jain of INOX Group on owning the first Tesla in India Inc.

$1 billion startup BlackBuck leaves Bengaluru office, blames potholesBengaluru firm BlackBuck, worth over $1 billion has decided to move out of their office in the city due to worsening pothole conditions.

BEL share price: Why is it rising today and should you buy?BEL shares rose during the trading session on strong Rs 712 crore order inflow, supported by robust backlog and bullish technicals, keeping investor sentiment positive and suggesting potential further upside in the near-term trading sessions.

Urban Company shares list at 58% premium: Should you book profit or hold?Urban Company share price: The strong debut reflects the high demand for Urban Company's IPO, which had been among the most closely watched offerings of 2025.

Urban Company share price: Stock makes bumper debut at 58% premiumUrban Company listed at a 57.5% premium at Rs 162.25 on the NSE. On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 161, marking a 56% gain over the Rs 103 issue price.

Experts bet big on this financial stock at record high. Should you buy?Experts recommend the financial stock as a strong buy for investors focusing on financial stocks, while also suggesting PSU banks, defence tech firms, and auto ancillary stocks as potential picks.

entertainment.headline: Anurag Kashyap calls out Bollywood's toxicity, criticises AI in cinemaAnurag Kashyap criticised the "toxicity" in Bollywood and said the industry can never be united. He also slammed AI-generated cinema, calling it unethical and warning that actors will only unite when technology begins replacing them.

Homebound co-writer Sumit Roy expresses pride as film gets picked for Oscars 2026Director Neeraj Ghaywan's film 'Homebound' has been selected for the Oscars race. The film's co-writer Sumit Roy reacted to the news expressing pride on representing India globally.

Zubeen Garg, Assam's OG pop balladeer, and the question Gaane ki AaneZubeen Garg wasn't just a singer. He was the voice of Assam, weaving raw emotion into every note that defined generations. From the superhit Maya to intimate folk melodies, Zubeen left an indelible mark. He proved that true music transcends time and controversy.

Karan Johar calls Homebound a labour of love as film heads to Oscars 2026Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound', produced by Karan Johar, has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026 in the Best International Feature category. Calling it a "labour of love," Johar expressed pride, while Ghaywan said representing India on a global stage was both "humbling and a matter of pride."

Rohit Saraf flaunts his abs in Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari song BTS picsRohit Saraf shared behind-the-scenes pictures from the new Holi song 'Panwadi' in his upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'.

Zubeen Garg's sister Jonkey Borthakur too died in accident; tragedy shaped musicLife's cruel symmetry has played out for the Borthakur family, after Assam's pop star Zubeen Garg lost his life in an accident in Singapore. Twenty-three years ago, Zubeen's sister, Jonkey, met with a road accident that resulted in the death of the 20-year-old singer and actor. Her death in 2002 left young Zubeen devastated and shaped his music, spirit, and musical journey.

Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound picked as India's official entry to OscarsDirector Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026. The film features Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor and Vishal Jethwa in key roles.

Jr NTR injured during ad shoot, advised rest for few weeks: Official statementTelugu superstar Jr NTR suffered a minor injury while shooting an ad. His team confirmed he is stable, recovering well, and advised rest for a few weeks. Fans are urged not to speculate.

Zubeen Garg dies at 52: Fans pay tribute to Assamese icon's musical legacySinger Zubeen Garg died at 52 after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. Fans mourned his death while cherishing his music and contribution towards Assamese culture.

Apateu, Apateu! How a Korean drinking game became world's newest pop obsessionIn this week's K-fix, we discuss how Rose and Bruno Mars' 'APT.' turns a Korean drinking game into a viral anthem, uniting fans worldwide with its addictive chant and playful lyrics.

Lord Curzon Ki Haveli: Anshuman Jha's directorial debut hits theatres this OctoberThe much-awaited black comedy thriller 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli', marking Anshuman Jha's directorial debut, is set to release in Indian theatres on October 10 after a successful international festival run.

Zubeen Garg dies at 52: Vishal Dadlani, Armaan Malik lead social media tributesThe sudden death of Zubeen Garg, the iconic Assamese singer and composer, has deeply saddened the music and film fraternity across India. Revered as the voice of Assam, his death was mourned by Vishal Dadlani, Pritam, Armaan Malik, among others.

Jolly LLB 3 X reviews: Akshay Kumar called content king by fansAkshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi-starrer 'Jolly LLB 3' was released in theatres today. The fans have been sharing their reviews on social media, calling Akshay the content king.

Mirage review: Underwhelming Jeethu Joseph crime thriller that barely takes offRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025'Mirage' movie review: Mirage is a Malayalam crime thriller co-written and directed by Jeethu Joseph of 'Drishyam' fame. The film is set around a financial scam and an accidental death that leads to deeper, darker revelations.

Harshdeep Kaur's soulful Ik Onkar resonates at Sikh Sangat led by PM Modi. WatchSinger Harshdeep Kaur met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the eve of his 75th birthday and called the moment an honour. At Modi's request, she sang a soulful rendition of 'Ik Onkar' from Gurbani.

Remembering Zubeen Garg, the Ya Ali singer and Assam's cultural icon who lives onZubeen Garg, a celebrated singer and musician from Assam, died at the age of 52 in Singapore. He was scheduled to perform at the ongoing Northeast Festival and died after a scuba diving accident. Garg was a multi-talented artiste known for his work in several Indian languages, and his loss has left a significant void in the music industry.

13th trailer: Paresh Pahuja highlights power of teachers beyond classroomsSony LIV's new drama series '13th: Some Lessons Aren't Taught in Classrooms' beautifully explores the deep bond between a mentor and his student. Inspired by the life of renowned educator Mohit Tyagi, the series stars Paresh Pahuja in the lead.

Firoz Nadiadwala sends legal notice to Netflix over use of Baburao characterProducer Feroze Nadiadwala has sent a legal notice to Netflix over the unauthorised use of the Baburao character. The move highlights the importance of protecting intellectual property rights in the creative sector.

Ya Ali singer Zubeen Garg, 52, dies after scuba diving accident in SingaporeRenowned Assamese singer Zubeen Garg, who rose to national fame with his hit song Ya Ali, died after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. He was 52 years old.

general news.headline: 2 jawans killed, 4 injured in firing on Assam Rifles convoy in ManipurUnknown gunmen ambushed an Assam Rifles convoy near Nambol Sabal Leikai in Manipur's Bishnupur district on Friday evening, leaving one jawan critically injured and several others wounded.

Trump, Xi hold first call in three months as trade, TikTok deal dominate agendaUS President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping spoke by phone for the first time in three months, focusing on trade tensions and a deal to keep TikTok running in the US.

Didn't mean to...: Sam Pitroda defends 'feel at home in Pak' remark after backlashSam Pitroda had triggered controversy after he said he "felt at home" during his visits to Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Nepal. He has now issued a statement clarifying his earlier remarks.

ABVP wins big in Dusu polls, Aryan Maan wrests President's post from NSUIAryan secured 28,841 votes, while NSUI's Joslyn managed 12,645. Of the four posts, ABVP won three — President, Secretary, and Joint Secretary — but lost the Vice President's seat.

Zubeen Garg, Assam's OG pop balladeer, and the question Gaane ki AaneZubeen Garg wasn't just a singer. He was the voice of Assam, weaving raw emotion into every note that defined generations. From the superhit Maya to intimate folk melodies, Zubeen left an indelible mark. He proved that true music transcends time and controversy.

BJP gets Gen Z bragging rightsEven as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi sought to woo Gen Z amid his "vote chori" pitch, the Delhi University Students Union (DUSU) election results will hand the BJP the bragging rights of support from that segment of the population. The ABVP, the student wing of the RSS, won three of the four key posts in the DUSU election, while Congress' NSUI won just one. Earlier this year, the ABVP gained ground at JNU, considered to be a left bastion.

Zubeen Garg's sister Jonkey Borthakur too died in accident; tragedy shaped musicLife's cruel symmetry has played out for the Borthakur family, after Assam's pop star Zubeen Garg lost his life in an accident in Singapore. Twenty-three years ago, Zubeen's sister, Jonkey, met with a road accident that resulted in the death of the 20-year-old singer and actor. Her death in 2002 left young Zubeen devastated and shaped his music, spirit, and musical journey.

Built like Arshad Nadeem, India's Sachin Yadav is tipped for Neeraj-like greatnessOnce a cricket-loving teenager from a small village, Sachin Yadav now competes with the world's best. After making a statement with a fourth-place finish at the Tokyo World Championships, the 25-year-old is being tipped for Olympic success in Los Angeles. His former coaches highlight what makes him special and why he draws comparisons to Pakistan's Olympic champion, Arshad Nadeem.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

Terror has a new address in Pakistan after Operation SindoorTerror groups like Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) and Hizbul Mujahideen are deliberately moving their infrastructure deeper into Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, calculating that KPK offers greater protection from future strikes by India.

Mumbai to get India's largest cruise terminal tomorrow, here's how it looksPM Modi will inaugurate Mumbai's International Cruise Terminal at Ballard Pier, marking a major boost for India's maritime infrastructure, set to handle one million passengers annually and elevate the city as a premier global cruise tourism hub.

Ya Ali singer Zubeen Garg, 52, dies after scuba diving accident in SingaporeRenowned Assamese singer Zubeen Garg, who rose to national fame with his hit song Ya Ali, died after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. He was 52 years old.

Faced racial hatred at Google job: Indian techie shot by US cops said on LinkedInTelangana techie Mohammed Nizamuddin was shot dead by the police in the US after an alleged scuffle with his roommate. In his last LinkedIn post, he claimed racial abuse, wrongful termination by the employer, and threats to his safety. His family has brought up these concerns and also appealed the Indian government for help in repatriating his body.

Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound picked as India's official entry to OscarsDirector Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026. The film features Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor and Vishal Jethwa in key roles.

Jolly LLB 3 review: Akshay-Arshad bring charm but Saurabh Shukla owns the courtroomRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Jolly LLB 3 review: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi deliver entertaining performances in Subhash Kapoor's courtroom drama, but it's Saurabh Shukla as Judge Tripathi who steals the show. A witty mix of satire, comedy, and social commentary, the film balances laughs with a hard-hitting story.
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

World should learn from India how to end a war real quick, says Air Force chiefIndia launched Operation Sindoor strikes against Pakistani terror infrastructure on May 7 and reached a ceasefire agreement in just four days of military conflict after achieving mission objective.

Watch: Group of men save eight-year-old girl choking on chewing gum in KeralaAn eight-year-old girl in Kannur began choking on chewing gum on Tuesday evening. She approached a group of young men across the road, and one of them provided emergency care. Locals praised her presence of mind and the youths' quick action.
JCB stirring dal in viral video leaves internet worried about food hygieneA video showing a JCB machine being used to stir dal has gone viral on social media.

When India gave China a bloody nose in forgotten battles of 1967After its humiliating defeat to China in the 1962 war, India turned the tables just a few years later. In two little-known battles in 1967 at Nathu La and Cho La, fought weeks apart, Indian forces pushed back the Chinese and restored a measure of pride. Eighty-eight Indian bravehearts laid down their lives, but the toll on the Chinese side was over 300. This victory cemented India's hold over Sikkim, and shattered China's aura of invincibility.

Israeli spokesperson praises Kolkata's Jewish bakery observing ShabbatKolkata's historic Nahoum & Sons, India's oldest Jewish bakery, features a poster highlighting the tradition: "Shop will remain closed Saturdays on account of Jewish Shabbat."

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

sports.headline: India finally remember Arshdeep, hand him Asia Cup game vs OmanAsia Cup 2025: India finally gave a match to Arshdeep Singh ahead of their Super 4 fixtures in the Asia Cup. The team opted for a fresh bowling combination for their match against Oman.

I have become like Rohit: Suryakumar jokes after forgetting team changes at tossIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav forgot one of the team changes before the Asia Cup match against Oman, taking a light-hearted jibe at former skipper Rohit Sharma — well known for his trademark forgetfulness.

PCB responds, says ICC protocols allow media managers to use camerasPakistan Cricket Board has defended its media manager for filming a meeting with the ICC match referee Andy Pycroft before the Asia Cup game against UAE. ICC CEO Sanjog Gupta had written to the PCB citing "multiple violations" of the Players and Match Officials Area (PMOA) code.

Kuldeep Yadav and I grew up playing together: Oman batter recalls childhood memoriesOman's Vinayak Shukla is set for an emotional Asia Cup clash against India, where he will face his childhood friend Kuldeep Yadav. Despite Oman's early exit from the tournament, Shukla cherishes the chance to test himself against top sides like India and Pakistan.

Neeraj, Arshad vow strong comebacks after World Championships setbacksNeeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem faced disappointing results at the Tokyo World Athletics Championships. Chopra finished eighth with a best throw of 84.03 m while Nadeem finished tenth with a best throw of 82.75m.

Heartbreak for Gulveer in 5k, Annu Rani disappoints in javelinWorld Athletics Championships: India's Gulveer Singh failed to qualify for the men's 5000m final by a narrow margin. Meanwhile, javelin thrower Annu Rani also exited early after a disappointing qualifying performance.

Built like Arshad Nadeem, India's Sachin Yadav is tipped for Neeraj-like greatnessOnce a cricket-loving teenager from a small village, Sachin Yadav now competes with the world's best. After making a statement with a fourth-place finish at the Tokyo World Championships, the 25-year-old is being tipped for Olympic success in Los Angeles. His former coaches highlight what makes him special and why he draws comparisons to Pakistan's Olympic champion, Arshad Nadeem.

Marcus Rashford eager to extend Barcelona stay after Newcastle heroicsMarcus Rashford said that he is eager to extend his stay at Barcelona after scoring a brace against Newcastle United in the Champions League on Thursday, September 18. Rashford is currently on loan from Manchester United.

Arsenal boardroom shake-up: Tim Lewis departs, Richard Garlick becomes CEOArsenal's boardroom sees a major shift as Tim Lewis stepped down from his role with Richard Garlick getting promoted to the role of CEO.

After Dhruv Jurel, Devudutt Padikkal hits composed century vs Australia ADevdutt Padikkal's composed century against Australia A signals his return to form. With the West Indies Test squad announcement approaching, the Karnataka batter strengthens his case for a middle-order spot in India's red-ball setup.

Heartbreak for Gulveer in 5k, Annu Rani disappoints in javelinWorld Athletics Championships: India's Gulveer Singh failed to qualify for the men's 5000m final by a narrow margin. Meanwhile, javelin thrower Annu Rani also exited early after a disappointing qualifying performance.

Built like Arshad Nadeem, India's Sachin Yadav is tipped for Neeraj-like greatnessOnce a cricket-loving teenager from a small village, Sachin Yadav now competes with the world's best. After making a statement with a fourth-place finish at the Tokyo World Championships, the 25-year-old is being tipped for Olympic success in Los Angeles. His former coaches highlight what makes him special and why he draws comparisons to Pakistan's Olympic champion, Arshad Nadeem.

Marcus Rashford eager to extend Barcelona stay after Newcastle heroicsMarcus Rashford said that he is eager to extend his stay at Barcelona after scoring a brace against Newcastle United in the Champions League on Thursday, September 18. Rashford is currently on loan from Manchester United.

Arsenal boardroom shake-up: Tim Lewis departs, Richard Garlick becomes CEOArsenal's boardroom sees a major shift as Tim Lewis stepped down from his role with Richard Garlick getting promoted to the role of CEO.

After Dhruv Jurel, Devudutt Padikkal hits composed century vs Australia ADevdutt Padikkal's composed century against Australia A signals his return to form. With the West Indies Test squad announcement approaching, the Karnataka batter strengthens his case for a middle-order spot in India's red-ball setup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
